name: [BF] nub
description:
## Background

In Haskell's `Data.List` module, the `nub` function is defined as follows:

> `$O(n^2)$`. The [nub](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/base-4.19.0.0/docs/Data-List.html#v:nub) function removes duplicate elements from a list. In particular, it keeps only the first occurrence of each element. (The name [nub](https://hackage.haskell.org/package/base-4.19.0.0/docs/Data-List.html#v:nub) means 'essence'.)


## Task

Your task is to implement this `nub` function in BF.

Write a BF program that takes a null-terminated string as input, removes the duplicate characters and outputs only the first occurrence of each character.

The charcode of the input characters ranges from `1` to `255` inclusive.


## Examples

```
        Input          |        Output
---------------------- | --------------------
     "hello world!\0" --> "helo wrd!"
      "Abracadabra\0" --> "Abracd"
              "nub\0" --> "nub"
     "\1\2\3\2\3\4\0" --> "\1\2\3\4"
                 "\0" --> ""
```
